articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Peace Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Peace Delegation
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk in a friendly atmosphere with the visiting delegation of the Chinese People's Association for Peace and Disarmament led by its Vice-President Li Wuwei, vice-chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, at Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
					 The head of the delegation offered warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on his election as first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Noting that the Chinese people recollect with deep emotion the efforts made by leader Kim Jong Il for the strengthening and development of Sino-DPRK friendship, he added that the bilateral friendship is developing as the days go by under the deep care of the supreme leaders of the two parties and the two countries.
					
					 He wished the Korean people greater successes in the building of a thriving nation, united close behind the WPK headed by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He expressed the will to join the Korean comrades in making positive efforts to boost the friendly ties between two countries.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets Chinese President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets Chinese President
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and president of the People's Republic of China, said that China will in the future, too, strive hard to boost the Sino-DPRK friendly relations in the spirit of "inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future, building good-neighborly friendship and strengthening cooperation." 
					 Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea who is heading the WPK delegation, paid a courtesy call on Hu Jintao at the Great Hall of the People on Monday.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il attached great importance to the Sino-DPRK friendship and strived hard to carry forward and develop it, Hu said, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il stressed the need to hand over the baton of this friendship, saying it is solid.
					
					 Through the talks and meetings with him both sides attained an important common understanding of boosting exchange and cooperation in various fields and sharing common views on international issues.
					
					 The feats he performed for the strengthening of the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship will last forever.
					
					 Hu said the Fourth WPK Conference and the fifth session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly, which were held at a time when the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung was being marked, were great events of weighty significance in promoting the party construction and the socialist cause.
					
					 We are pleased with the achievements made by the Korean people in building a thriving socialist nation, rallied close around the WPK headed by Comrade Kim Jong Un true to the behests of Kim Jong Il, he noted.
					
					 He expressed belief that the party, government and people of the DPRK would make new steady successes under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The traditional Sino-DPRK friendship has become common wealth as it was provided and brought into bloom by the revolutionaries of the elder generation of the two parties and two countries, Hu said, and continued:
					
					 The international situation has become complicated recently but the Sino-DPRK friendship is steadily growing stronger.
					
					 It is the steadfast policy of the Chinese party and government to attach great importance to the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship and steadily develop it.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets Senior Chinese Official
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets Senior Chinese Official
 Beijing, April 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on April 22 met and had a talk with Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, member of its Secretariat and head of its Organization Department, in Beijing.
					 Li Yuanchao recollected with deep emotion his visit to the DPRK last year during which he was received by leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Noting that the Fourth Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea decided to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as general secretary of the WPK forever and the 5th session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly decided to hold him in high esteem as chairman of the National Defence Commission forever, he said this was a manifestation of the firm will of the party and people of the DPRK to successfully accomplish the socialist cause under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Sino-DPRK friendship provided and cultivated by the leaders of elder generations of the two countries is deeply rooted in the minds of the two peoples in the course of the struggle against their joint enemies, he said, adding: 
					
					 The party and government of China will make positive efforts in the future, too, to further boost the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship together with the party and government of the DPRK.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Comes Back Home
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Comes Back Home
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., WPK, returned home Tuesday after visiting China.

articles.title: Congratulations from Russian President
articles.content:
Congratulations from Russian President
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message from Russian President D. Medvedev on April 20.
					 The message said: 
					
					 Esteemed Your Excellency Kim Jong Un,
					
					 Please accept my congratulations to you on your election as first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					
					 I am convinced that you will strengthen the peace in the Korean Peninsula and the regional security and fully carry forward the traditional line for close cooperation between the DPRK and the Russian Federation while working at the top state post of the DPRK.
					
					 I wish you success in your responsible work.

articles.title: Congratulations from Cambodian King
articles.content:
Congratulations from Cambodian King
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) --The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message from Norodom Sihamoni, king of Cambodia, on April 21.
					  The message said:
					
					  It gives me pleasure to send warm congratulations to Your Excellency on behalf of the parliament and Senate, government and people of the Kingdom of Cambodia, and on my own behalf, on your election as first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the  DPRK.
					
					 It is my belief that the DPRK will achieve greater development, prosperity and progress in all fields and victory in performing an important role in the region and other parts of the world under your outstanding leadership. 
					
					 The peoples of the Kingdom of Cambodia and the DPRK, in particular, will achieve greater victory in boosting the solidarity and the historic bonds of friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries.
					
					 Please accept my highest tribute to Your Excellency.

articles.title: Congratulations from Ethiopian President
articles.content:
Congratulations from Ethiopian President
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message from Girma Wolde -Giorgis, president of Ethiopia, on April 18.
					 The message said:
					
					It gives me pleasure to send warmest congratulations to Your Excellency on behalf of the people and government of Ethiopia and on my own behalf on your  election as first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK at the fifth session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK held on April 13, 2012. 
					
					 Please accept Your Excellency my best wishes for your happiness and lasting peace and prosperity for the friendly people of the DPRK.

articles.title: Congratulations from Foreign Political Party Leaders
articles.content:
Congratulations from Foreign Political Party Leaders
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received messages of congratulation from foreign political party leaders on April 13 and 16 upon his election as first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission. 
					 They included Renato Ravello, national chairman of the Central Committee of the Brazilian Communist Party, and Ricardo Alemao Abreu, its international secretary, Prakash Karat, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), and Pierre Ngolo, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Congolese Party of Labour.
					
					 In the messages, they said that Kim Jong Un's election as first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission was a political event that demonstrated the fixed will of the army and the people of the DPRK to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche and Songun under his leadership.
					
					 The messages wished him success in his work, reaffirming the will to strengthen the friendship and solidarity among countries.

articles.title: Congratulations from Foreign Party Leaders
articles.content:
Congratulations from Foreign Party Leaders
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, received congratulatory messages from Petro Nikolayevich Symonenko, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Ukrainian Communist Party, and Sh. Shabdolov, chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, on April 12 and 14.
					 They in their messages extended congratulations to Kim Jong Un on his election as first secretary of the WPK and chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK.
					
					 They wished him fresh success in socialist construction.
					
					 Kim Jong Un also received messages of greeting from Vladimir Voronin, chairman of the Party of Communists of the Moldovan Republic, and Prakash Karat, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), on April 12 and 13 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Gift from Int'l Financial Association in China

articles.title: Floral Basket from Military Attaches Corps
articles.content:

					 The floral basket and congratulatory message were handed to KPA Vice-Marshal Kim Jong Gak, minister of the People's Armed Forces, by Vietnamese Military Attache Nguyen Van Lich, head of the military attaches corps, Tuesday.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Chinese Family
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Chinese Family
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from the family of Zhang Weihua, Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, on Tuesday on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Floral Baskets from Chinese

They are visiting the DPRK on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Floral Baskets from Japanese Organizations and Personages

 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Okayama Prefecture for Japan-Korea friendship headed by Seisuke Mihara, representative of the Association for Promotion of Friendship between Japan and North and South Korea, flew back by air on Tuesday.

articles.title: Military Attaches Corps Feted
articles.content:
Military Attaches Corps Feted
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of the People's Armed Forces gave a reception in honor of the military attaches corps here on Tuesday on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Army.
					 Present there on invitation were members of the corps led by Nguyen Van Lich, military attache of the Vietnamese embassy here.
					
					 Present there were KPA Vice Marshal Kim Jong Gak, minister of the People's Armed Forces, and generals and other officers of the KPA.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Grand Performance Celebrates 80th KPA Anniversary
articles.content:
Grand Performance Celebrates 80th KPA Anniversary
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- A grand performance "Glory to Service Personnel of the Heroic Korean People's Army" was given with splendor at Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on Tuesday in celebration of the 80th anniversary of the KPA.
					 Among the audience were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim and other senior party, state and army officials, a chairperson of a friendly party, officials of the party, armed forces and power bodies, public organizations, ministries and national institutions, officials in the fields of science, education, literature and culture, public health and the press, servicepersons of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, men of merits and working people in the city.
					
					 Present there on invitation were overseas compatriots delegations and compatriots, the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front, diplomatic envoys of various countries, members of the military attaches corps here and foreign guests. 
					
					 The performance began with chorus of prelude "The Victorious Parade".
					
					 Chapter 1 "Iron-willed Brilliant Commander" included male solo and chorus "Sentinels Offer Warm Salute to the Leader", male chorus "Song of the Korean People's Army" and chorus "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung".
					
					 The performers impressively represented the immortal feats the President performed by founding the revolutionary army and thereby pioneering the revolutionary cause of Juche advancing by dint of arms.
					
					 Chapter 2 "Brilliant Commander of Songun" included female solo and chorus "Chol Pass" and chorus "Thunder over Jong Il Peak".  They sang of the feats Generalissimo Kim Jong Il performed by developing the KPA into the elite army with his original Songun politics and thus ushering in a new great history of defending socialism and bringing about the prosperity of the country. 
					
					 Also put on the stage were numbers showing the true picture of the strong revolutionary army which has been trained under the care of the great brilliant commanders.
					
					 The performance reached its climax with epilog "Forward for Final Victory!" 
					
					  Choruses "Footsteps" and "Let Korea of Sun Demonstrate Its Might before the World" rocked the stadium.

articles.title: Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition Opens
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia exhibition for celebrating the 80th anniversary of the Korean People's Army opened here with due ceremony on Tuesday.
					 Displayed in its venue is a picture of smiling Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Seen there are such letters as "Broad Smile" and "We Miss You" and model of star of the Generalissimo. 
					
					 On display at the venue are immortal flowers cultivated by many units including the armed forces and power bodies, the Cabinet, ministries and national institutions and organs of science, education, public health and media and industrial establishments. 
					
					 Among them are flowers from the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, members of the Society for Supporting the Dissemination of Immortal Flowers and Chinese residents in the DPRK. 
					
					 The exhibition will last till April 27.

articles.title: People's Delegations Visit KPA Units
articles.content:
People's Delegations Visit KPA Units
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- People's delegations visited the units of the three services of the Korean People's Army to mark the 80th anniversary of the KPA.
					 When they arrived at the units, service personnel presented them with flowers, welcoming them with warm feelings.
					
					 There took place meetings for conveying the gifts from Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The delegations handed them to the units.
					
					 Members of the delegations introduced the new of the people accelerating the grand march and the stirring situation of the country, handing aid materials.
					
					 They went round monuments to the revolutionary activities of leader Kim Jong Il, rooms for the education in the revolutionary history and other places and watched the servicepersons in military training.
					
					 They had sports and amusement games and enjoyed art performances together with servicepersons.
					
					 Spending pleasant times with service personnel, they requested them to firmly defend the country.
					
					 Servicepersons expressed their firm resolutions to guarantee the building of a thriving nation of Juche with arms and wipe out the enemies with merciless strike if they ignite a war on this land, always remembering the request of the country and its people.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Cemeteries and Memorial Tower
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Cemeteries and Memorial Tower
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery and floral baskets before the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower on Tuesday on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					 Seen in the wreath-laying stands at the cemeteries were wreaths sent by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present at the ceremonies were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Ho and other senior party, state and army officials, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, social organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and working people in Pyongyang. 
					
					 The participants laid bouquets and flowers before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero, at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and observed a moment's silence in memory of the woman general on Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Placed in the wreath-laying stands at the cemeteries were wreaths in the name of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK. A floral basket in the joint name of the C.C, and the Central Military Commission of the WPK was laid before the main theme sculpture "Victory" at the Memorial Tower.
					
					 Also placed were wreaths and floral baskets in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security, social organizations, ministries and national institutions, units of the KPA, organs in the fields of science, education, literature and arts, public health and media as well as party and power organs, farms and other institutions in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence to memorize the fallen fighters. 
					
					 They expressed respect for service personnel of the KPA who performed merits in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The military attaches corps here also laid a wreath and a floral basket before the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower on the same day.

articles.title: Military Attaches Corps Visits KPA Exhibition of Arms and Equipment
articles.content:
Military Attaches Corps Visits KPA Exhibition of Arms and Equipment
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps and staff members of foreign embassies here visited the Exhibition of Arms and Equipment of the Korean People's Army on Tuesday on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the Korean People's Army. 
					 The visitors went round all types of artillery pieces, tanks, armored vehicles, warships, aircraft, strategic rockets and other weaponry and combat and technical equipment, being briefed on the undying feats the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu performed in building and developing the nation's  powerful defence industry. 
					
					 They made entries in the visitor's book. 
					
					 Military Attache of the Vietnamese embassy here Nguyen Van Lich who is doyen of the military attaches corps wrote that the KPA is equipped with advanced weaponry capable of beating back any military powers of the world. 
					
					 Zhang Ping, military, naval and air attache of the Chinese embassy here, wrote that the exhibition of the KPA shows a glorious history of achievements made by the Korean people in defence upbuilding. 
					
					 The KPA has powerful combat capability as brave and heroic combat ranks, he added. 
					
					 A staff member of the Egyptian embassy here wrote that the exhibition better than all other military museums in the world showcases the invincible power of the KPA. 
					
					 The second secretary of the Pakistani embassy here expressed hope that that the army and people of the DPRK would achieve bigger progress in national defence and other fields under the wise leadership of the Supreme Commander of the KPA.

articles.title: Foreigners Visit Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition
articles.content:
Foreigners Visit Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys and the economic and commercial councilors corps here Tuesday visited the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia exhibition for celebrating the 80th anniversary of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 They went round the venue of the exhibition, being briefed on the immortal flowers blooming thanks to deep reverence and sincere minds of the Korean people praising the peerlessly great persons.
					
					 Iranian Ambassador Morteza Moradian said that the exhibition of immortal flowers showed well the will of the DPRK government and people to build a thriving nation.
					
					 He wholeheartedly wished Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people, good health, warmly congratulating the Korean people on the 80th anniversary of the heroic KPA.
					
					 Arkady Lavrov, senior councilor of the Russian embassy, in a visitor's book wrote that the exhibition offered an opportunity for him to deeply feel the boundless reverence of the Korean people for President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Economic Councilors Corps Pays Floral Tribute to Statues
articles.content:
Economic Councilors Corps Pays Floral Tribute to Statues
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The economic and commercial councilors corps here Tuesday laid a floral basket before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					 The guests paid tributes before the statues.

articles.title: KPA Turned into Strong Army under Guidance of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
KPA Turned into Strong Army under Guidance of Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The Korean People's Army will mark its 80th birthday on Wednesday. Recorded in its glorious history are the undying feats of leader Kim Jong Il, who had steadily strengthened it into the army of the party and the leader.
					 In his early years Kim Jong Il set it as a programme for army building to model the whole army on the Juche idea and did his utmost to train the KPA to be ranks of vanguard fighters regarding it as their life and soul to devotedly defend their leader.
					
					 He promoted the movement for winning the title of O Jung Hup-led Seventh Regiment in the whole army so as to prepare the servicepersons to be strong in ideology and faith with the steadfast spirit of devotedly safeguarding their leader.
					
					 His inspection of Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division was a solemn declaration of the start of his Songun (military-first) guidance.
					
					In the 1990s he pursued in an overall way the Songun politics with the People's Army as the main force of the revolution to meet the demands of the prevailing situation and the developing revolution.
					
					 He had wisely guided the KPA to grow to be ever-victorious army capable of defeating any formidable enemy at one stroke, as required by the Workers' Party of Korea's military strategic idea and Juche-based war method. 
					
					 Visiting many units across the country in disregard of weather conditions, he gave courage to the servicepersons and took parental care of their living conditions.
					
					 He also paid deep attention to updating the country's defence industry and remarkably increasing the KPA's might in military technique. After all, the KPA has grown to be an elite army equipped with modern offensive and defensive means.
					
					 On the occasion of the army day, all the people, including servicepersons, are sorely missing Kim Jong Il, illustrious commander of Mt. Paektu, looking back on the glorious course of victory covered by them under his guidance.

articles.title: Youth Vow to Become 5 Million Human Bullets and Bombs
articles.content:
Youth Vow to Become 5 Million Human Bullets and Bombs
Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Youth and students held a meeting at the Youth Park Open-air Theatre in Pyongyang on Tuesday to vow to beat to death the group of rat-like Lee Myung Bak, the sworn enemy. 
					 A statement issued by a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army was read out to be followed by speeches.
					
					  At a time when the whole mankind is unsparing of its admiration and praise of celebrations of the Day of the Sun as they fully demonstrated the invincible might of Songun Korea and the true picture of single-minded unity, the group of rat-like Lee Myung Bak perpetuated without hesitation such hideous provocations as daring hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, they said, and went on:
					
					 The hooliganism perpetrated by this rat-like group, obsessed with confrontation with compatriots, is the crimes that put the successive ruling quarters and dictators of south Korea into the shade and a blatant challenge and a clear declaration of a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The hearts of the youth and students across the country are burning with the determination to wipe out the hysteric group, the root cause of misfortune from this land, to the last man.
					
					 Now is the time for the young people who grew up under the care of the great Songun brilliant commander to mercilessly punish the provocateurs, they declared, volunteering to join or rejoin the Korean People's Army. 
					
					  Once the Supreme Commander of the KPA issues an order, the youth and students will become 5 million human bullets and bombs to deal retaliatory blows of justice to cut off the windpipes of rat-like group at a single strike and accomplish the historic cause of national reunification.
					
					 A resolution of revenge was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: DPRK People Ready to Take Revenge on S. Korean Regime
articles.content:
DPRK People Ready to Take Revenge on S. Korean Regime
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army on April 18 issued a statement hitting traitor Lee Myung Bak and his group of south Korea for hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Upon hearing the statement, the servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK hardly repress their surging indignation at the Lee swarm of rats, ready to make revenge upon it. 
					
					 An officer of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces (KPISF), Jang Nam Hyok, told KCNA:
					
					 "Now we are on a high alert to destroy at a stroke the rat-like Lee Myung Bak group that committed a thrice-cursed treason.
					
					 We will cut off the windpipes of the swarm of rats, hell-bent on hideous provocations, and blow up its provocation bases, as well."
					
					 A KPISF officer, Jo Pyong Sam, said:
					
					 "It is high time that we settled accounts with the rat-like Lee group.
					
					 Once the respected supreme commander gives us an order, we will wipe out the group of rats with merciless retaliatory blow."
					
					 Ju Yong Jin, an employee of the Pyongyang Textile Machine Plant, said:
					
					 "The servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK value the dignity of its supreme leadership more precious than their own lives. And, by dint of the might of single-minded unity, we will take our merciless revenge upon the criminals.
					
					 Once an order is given, I will rejoin the army for a sacred war to make a clean sweep of all those rats."

articles.title: Militiamen Willing to Join in Actions to Wipe out S. Korean Regime
articles.content:
Militiamen Willing to Join in Actions to Wipe out S. Korean Regime
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The special operation action group of the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army (KPA) on Monday issued a notice that the special actions of the armed forces of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea would start soon to meet the reckless challenge of south Korea's Lee Myung Bak group of traitors.
					 Upon hearing this notice, members of the Worker-Peasant Red Guards are hardening their will to wipe out the enemies while intensifying the military training.
					
					 Kim Song Chol, an officer of the Pothonggang District, Pyongyang, Worker-Peasant Red Guards, told KCNA:
					
					 "The notice represented the unanimous will of all members of the Red Guards as well as the will of the army and the people. We are now eager to join in the special actions of the revolutionary armed forces.
					
					 Now is the time to punish rat-like Lee Myung Bak and his group of human dregs at the court of history. Myung Bak should be mindful that we, all the members of the Red Guards, will dismember him as many as our heads."
					
					 Noting that he feels relieved to hear the notice, Kim Kwang Chol, a member of the guards, said:
					
					 "The notice represents a surging indignation of the servicepersons and civilians in the DPRK. I think the special actions are indicative of starting of the sacred war to be launched by the DPRK people for the sake of the dignity of their supreme leadership.
					
					 Respected Supreme Commander, please give us an order. Together with the KPA, we will join the sacred war to trample down to death the human dregs, the swarm of rats, or hang them to death, in revenge for their insult to the dignity of our supreme leadership."
					
					 Choe Kyong Hui, a member of the guards, said:
					
					 "Their frantic provocation has reached the danger line. I am resolved to turn into ashes all the swarms of rats, including traitor Lee Myung Bak, as well as the provocation bases, once an order for southward advancement is given."
					
					 Members of the Pothonggang District Worker-Peasant Red Guards were seen bayoneting rat-like Myung Bak in effigy on the training ground.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of rats in effigy has become targets of their aiming drill and live-firing at the ground.

 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- No sooner had the people in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea celebrated most significantly President Kim Il Sung's 100th birth anniversary than they were seized with hatred for the rat-like Myung Bak, who masterminded the hideous provocation against the DPRK.
					 Lee Myung Bak is identical to a rat that keeps its own life with theft, inhabiting in a malodor-reeking ditch. Soon after he took office he has traded away the nation's interests and worked hard to brew distrust among fellow countrymen.
					
					 Worse still, he dared desecrate the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership. 
					
					 Cartoons satirizing rat-like Myung Bak have been screened on TV in the DPRK.
					
					 The people, regardless of sex and age, get to tremble to see the rat-faced Myung Bak.
					
					 Women are blaming Myung Bak's mother for giving birth to a rattish son. In evenings, children are seen playing rat ridding, setting afire pieces of papers written with letters "Rat-like Myung Bak."
					
					 The burning papers remind one of the wretched plight of rat-like Myung Bak who is doomed to death.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime, Harmful to Fellow Countrymen
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime, Harmful to Fellow Countrymen
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Broad masses of south Korea have been seized with delight at the look of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, who appeared himself in public view at the events to celebrate President Kim Il Sung's 100th birth anniversary.
					 But, only the rat-like Lee Myung Bak group of traitors committed a hideous crime of daring hurt again the dignity of the supreme leadership of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					 The gangster-like group egged riff-raffs on to make the hysteric acts in the heart of Seoul City.
					
					 The rowdyism clearly proved that the rat-like Lee group has given up being members of the Korean nation by itself.

					 It totally denied the June 15 joint declaration adopted between the north and south, thus putting an end to the inter-Korean relations that had been developing on good terms.
					
					 It has also driven the situation of the Korean Peninsula to the brink of war in collusion with outside forces, while turning south Korea into a graveyard of human rights and a theatre of fascist rowdyism.
					
					 That is why the south Korean people call Lee Myung Bak rat-like Bak.
					
					 As there is a saying that the face is the index of the heart, the rattish Lee's behaviors are entirely redolent of the way of a rat's existence.
					
					 The wretched colors of the Lee swarm of rats have already been revealed, as being only harmful to the nation and root cause of misfortunes.
					
					 If this group is allowed to commit such treachery, it is evident that the Korean nation would suffer big misfortune.
					
					 The entire nation will turn out in the campaign to hang to death rat-like Lee Myung Bak. The day is coming nearer.

articles.title: World Congress on Juche Idea Held Splendidly in Pyongyang
articles.content:
World Congress on Juche Idea Held Splendidly in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The World Congress on the Juche Idea took place splendidly in Pyongyang to celebrate the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung (April 15), the Day of the Sun.
					 Attending it were delegations and delegates from an estimated 60 countries.
					
					 The congress praised Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, who founded and developed in depth the Juche idea, and described the idea as a beacon of hope showing the road ahead of the world progressives.
					
					 An opening address was made at the congress by Vishwanath, secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea.
					
					 The Juche idea is shining with the august names of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism is the great idea, the acme of human ideologies in history, he stressed.
					
					 Speakers at the congress proved that the Juche idea has served as a widely accepted guiding idea representing the whole history of humankind.
					
					 They expressed the belief that the popular masses would win in the struggle to build an independent, new world under the banner of the Juche idea. 
					
					 A Pyongyang declaration of the World Congress on the Juche Idea was adopted.
					
					 The congress adopted a letter to the dear respected Kim Jong Un. In the letter its participants expressed the determination to keep Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism as their unshakable faith and conduct the study and dissemination of it in a more extensive and profound way. 
					
					 The letter stressed that it is great fortune not only of the Korean people but also of the world progressives to have Kim Jong Un as the supreme leader of the DPRK.
					
					 The participants in the congress presented commemorative stones to the Tower of the Juche Idea. 
					
					 They also attended colorful celebrations of the Day of the Sun. 
					
					 During their stay in Pyongyang, they visited the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm and Hana Music Information Center.
					
					 Merited foreign personages were awarded DPRK orders, medals and academic degrees.

articles.title: Floral Tribute by Chinese Peace Delegation
articles.content:
Floral Tribute by Chinese Peace Delegation
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The visiting delegation of the Chinese People's Association for Peace and Disarmament led by its Vice-President Li Wuwei, vice-chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, laid wreaths at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Friendship Tower on Tuesday.
					 Participating in the laying ceremony were Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the DPRK Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and vice-chairman of the National Peace Committee of Korea, and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 The members of the delegation laid bouquets before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk in the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and observed a moment's silence in memory of her.
					
					 Wreaths in the name of the delegation were laid at the Cemetery and the Friendship Tower.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the memory of the revolutionary martyrs who devoted all their life to the liberation of the country, socialist construction and accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche and the martyrs of the Chinese People's Volunteers who laid down their lives in their brave fight in the Korean War.

articles.title: DPRK Order Awarded to Egyptian Businessman
articles.content:
DPRK Order Awarded to Egyptian Businessman
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Order of DPRK Friendship 2nd Class was awarded to Ezzeldin Heikal, permanent representative of the Orascom Telecom Media and Technology Holdings SAE of Egypt here.
					 He made active contributions to boosting relations of friendship and economic cooperation between the DPRK and Egypt.
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.

articles.title: New Street of Restaurants Built in S. Phyongan Province
articles.content:
New Street of Restaurants Built in S. Phyongan Province
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- A street of restaurants was newly built in the Jungdok area in Phyongsong City, South Phyongan Province of the DPRK.
					 There include houses serving casserole, noodle, tangogi soup and entrails soup. A meat shop was also built there, making it possible to improve the people's diet.
					
					 The street is decorated with peculiar display of colorful light.

articles.title: Indonesian Chorus Acclaimed at Art Festival
articles.content:
Indonesian Chorus Acclaimed at Art Festival
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The Surya Chorus of Indonesia is one of the art groups that were popular at the 28th April Spring Friendship Art Festival held in Pyongyang.
					 It was the first time for the chorus to take part in the festival. Informed of the festival to be held on the occasion of President Kim Il Sung's 100th birth anniversary, the Indonesian government decided to send the chorus to Pyongyang to show the Indonesian people's reverence for him at the festival.
					
					 Organized in Juche 88 (1999), the chorus involves famous singers.
					
					 It had attended concerts hosted by the Indonesian president on scores of occasions, and rose to fame at various art festivals of Asian countries.
					
					 The chorus put on the stage of the April Art Festival Korean songs "Don't Advance Night of Pyongyang" and "I Cannot Tell It Yet", drawing bursts of applauds from the audience.

articles.title: Japanese Singer Prays for Immortality of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Japanese Singer Prays for Immortality of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- A Japanese singer Yoko Tooyama, who is a member of the Japan-Korea Society for Music and Art Interchange, was one of the participants in the 28th April Spring Friendship Art Festival.
					 Noting that she thought of President Kim Il Sung when singing the Korean song, Tooyama told KCNA:
					
					 It was after the passing away of Kim Il Sung when I first visited Pyongyang with Mitsuko Okasawara, former chairwoman of the society.
					
					 The chairwoman had honor to be received by the President on several occasions, but I did not.
					
					 However, I have learnt a lot about his noble life. I chose to sing the Korean song "The Man Who Remains in My Heart", praying for his immortality.
					
					 Thanks to the strong sense of moral obligation the dear respected Kim Jong Un has, the history of the Sun runs uninterruptedly in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
					
					 Promising is the future of the DPRK in which the cause of perpetuating the memory of precedent leaders has been realized with credit.
					
					 I am very pleased to hear that our performance somewhat delighted Korean people in celebrating Kim Il Sung's 100th birth anniversary.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group Accused of Pushing Inter-Korean Relations to War
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group Accused of Pushing Inter-Korean Relations to War
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors committed the thrice-cursed act of seriously hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. This is nothing but a hysteric rampage which can be perpetrated only by those keen to provoke a war against the north, steeped in extreme hostility and confrontation with compatriots to the marrow of their bones.

					The hideous provocations of the Lee group betray its sinister aim to rattle the nerves of the DPRK and escalate the north-south confrontation and tensions and they are an inevitable product of its scenario for a war against it, the article notes, and goes on:

					 Peace on the Korean Peninsula is seriously disturbed and the outbreak of a war is a matter of time due to the puppet warmongers' reckless provocations.
					
					 The final conclusion drawn under the present grave situation is that the Korean nation cannot live in peace even a moment as long as the rat-like Lee Myung Bak is allowed to go scot-free.
					
					 The three services of the revolutionary armed forces of Mt. Paektu are anxiously waiting for an order to wipe out the Lee group of traitors, the sworn enemy. 
					
					 One's evil doings will rebound on oneself and evil acts are bound to invite merciless punishment.
					
					 The enemies whoever they may be and the rat-like group wherever it goes will not be able to escape retaliation of the army and the people of the DPRK.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Lashes out at Group of Rat-like Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Lashes out at Group of Rat-like Lee Myung Bak
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The group of rat-like Lee Myung Bak of south Korea is pointing an accusing finger at the sun.
					 At a time when celebrations for the Day of the Sun were at the height in the DPRK, Lee Myung Bak let loose invectives against the DPRK, saying that it might have used a certain amount of money for the long-range missile launch and it could have bought a certain amount of corn with that much.
					
					 As if they had been waiting for the opportunity to happen, wicked conservative media speaking for the group of rats made vituperation against the DPRK, saying that it poured colossal amount of fund into the celebrations for the Day of the Sun and it could have bought food enough to sustain for years with that amount.
					
					 Lee, much upset by the cheers raised at the grand festival, made provocation against the DPRK with his rat-like face frowned.
					
					 This was a hideous insult to the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and an intolerable provocation against the system and people in the DPRK.
					
					 The Lee group dared try to estimate expenses for the celebrations for the birth anniversary of the great father of the nation, a mockery of the pure and warm loyalty of the army and people of the DPRK.
					
					 As live-televised worldwide, the celebrations for the 100th Day of the Sun have had tremendous impact on the times, history, the nation and humankind and had international repercussions.
					
					 The rats can never understand the reason of the bright human world as they are fond of dark ditches.
					
					 The Lee group which is made up of moneygrubbers can never understand the noble spiritual world of the army and people of the DPRK and the dignity and pride of the sun's nation which is incalculable with money.
					
					 If ever there is anything that should be taken into financial account, that is the treacherous crimes committed by rat-like Lee and his group.
					
					 A rat is said to carry a sack of salt overnight. But during his four years in office Lee offered south Korea to the master in its entirety. 
					
					 He kowtowed to the U.S. line and made a mess of politics, economy, culture, military affair and everything of south Korea, while making nonsensical talk that "there is no south Korea without the U.S." and "it can prosper only under the U.S."
					
					 Examples indicating the Lee group's sordid nature of serving the U.S. are the import of beef fraught with the danger of mad cow disease, resumption of dispatch of soldiers to Afghanistan, increase of fund for upkeep of the U.S. forces, active participation in the U.S.-led missile defense system and the Proliferation Security Initiative and the railroading of south Korea-U.S. "Free Trade Agreement" through a National Assembly session.
					
					 South Korea is a dark land where the rich get ever richer and the poor ever poorer, a land troubled by a great number of suicides.
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that the south Korean political and social circles are becoming increasingly assertive demanding his earliest resignation, calling his four years of politics as "failed politics", "wicked politics" and "politics with nothing to recollect".
					
					 The group of rat-like Lee, human scum, is the rubbish of the times which ought to be thrown onto scrap heap.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will wage a war of retaliation and wipe out the Lee group which defamed the nation and humanity.

articles.title: Double Standards Intolerable: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Double Standards Intolerable: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and other hostile forces are undisguisedly applying double standards as regards the manufacture and launch of satellites and the missile issue.
					 Questioned by journalists about how does the U.S. think about the West's attitude of refraining from making any criticism of the launch of an inter-continental ballistic missile by a country in South Asia though it pulled up the DPRK over its satellite launch, spokesmen for the U.S. administration and the State Department answered on April 19 that "that country is quite different from the case of the DPRK as it is cooperating well with the international community in the issue of non-proliferation".
					
					 They even talked such nonsense that one should repudiate the view that north Korea is just the same as that country and that the countries capable of launching missiles should exercise patience. Some satellite launching states are asserting that country poses no problem as it is a "partner."
					
					 What matters here is not the manufacture and launch of satellite and, furthermore, the issue of missile launch itself, but the double standards applied to handling these issues.
					
					 Space is not monopoly of someone but belongs to humankind and is something to be commonly used by it.
					
					 The International Space Treaty stipulates that the outer space shall be opened so that all states may study and use it without any distinction on an equal basis and it shall not be a monopoly of any individual state for meeting its interests.
					
					 This clearly proves that all countries have a legitimate right to develop and use the outer space, pursuant to their own development strategy.
					
					 The DPRK's launch of satellite was a great deed to be hailed by all people as it was in line with its Juche-based policy of space development and the International Space Treaty. Therefore, this can by no means be an issue to be criticized by someone.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. and other hostile forces described the DPRK's launch of every satellite for peaceful purposes as "a missile launch." Not content with this, they forced the UNSC to adopt a presidential statement, claiming that "north Korea is not allowed to launch even a satellite for peaceful purposes." This is a far-fetched assertion, indeed.
					
					 We would like to question whether the U.S. and other satellite launching states have ever got any approval from someone before putting at least tens of thousands of space vehicles into outer space for the past more than five decades.
					
					 The launch of inter-continental ballistic missiles by less than ten countries has neither got any approval from the international community nor has ever been criticized by international bodies.
					
					 Activities for space development and missile launch by certain countries are overlooked though they are of military nature whereas some countries are accused of developing space though it is for peaceful purposes. This is the height of impudence, partiality and double standards.
					
					 The U.S. is undisguisedly spying sovereign states by use of many satellites in the space and some countries launched a lot of satellites and had access to inter-continental ballistic missiles. Those countries have no right to talk about the DPRK's launch of satellite for peaceful purposes.
					
					 The principle of equal sovereignty and non-interference in other's internal affairs are strongly asserted by the international community than ever before. It was against this background that the satellite launch for peaceful purposes was described as a launch of inter-continental ballistic missile and brought into question while the open launch of such missile was allowed within a week. This undisguised application of the double standards is intolerable.
					
					 It has become clear that the hostile forces persistently term the DPRK satellite launch "a missile threat" and "provocation" as they are extremely displeased with the exalting dignity, growing might and eye-opening development of the DPRK.
					
					 Satellite launch is an exercise of an inviolable sovereign right and legitimate right of the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK will, as in the past, never allow the U.S. and other satellite launching states to interfere in its satellite launch for peaceful purposes.

articles.title: Sex Inequality Serious in S. Korea
articles.content:
Sex Inequality Serious in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Sex inequality has become a serious problem in south Korea, according to CBS of south Korea on April 20. 
					 A survey made by a regional organization of women's position in the fields of politics, economy, education, etc. proved that sex inequality is most serious in south Korea.
					
					 This is the natural consequences of the unpopular rule of the present ruling quarters. 
					
					 Since the very day the Lee group of traitors came to power, it has enforced a policy for big businesses under the motto of "pragmatism", increasing the inequality, a serious social problem. 
					
					  84,000 jobs for women were cut down in January 2009 alone due to restructuring pursuant to the pro-big business policy and lay-off.
					
					 Women became the primary target of the lay-off measure.
					
					 Under the patronage of the authorities, company owners put women on top of the list of workers to be discharged under the pretext of pregnancy and childbirth when lay-off is raised.
					
					 Those women who escaped lay-off by good fortune cannot free from discrimination.
					
					 An overwhelming majority of women out of the workers are part-timers arousing serious social concern as they are exposed to constant threat of dismissal.
					
					 Women workers are paid far less than men for the same work done by them.
					
					 Company owners' sexual abuses against women in work sites are becoming evermore undisguised. They live in uneasiness and fear everyday, subject to double and treble oppression and discrimination.

articles.title: End to Lee Myung Bak Regime's Rampage Demanded
articles.content:
End to Lee Myung Bak Regime's Rampage Demanded
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Saram Ilbo posted an article contributed by Jo Yong Gon, honorary chairman of the Academic Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration, on April 19.
					 52 years have passed since the April 19 Popular Uprising, but such rampage as execution of patriotic figures demanding peaceful reunification, crackdown on progressive media and popular masses through the enforcement of the horror policy backed by "the Security Law", rampant irregularities and corruption, economic bankruptcy, deterioration of people's living, etc. have become more horrible under the Lee Myung Bak regime, the article deplored.
					
					 It called for putting a definite end to the rampage of pro-U.S. and sycophantic conservative forces in this land by carrying forward the spirit of the April 19 Popular Uprising which demanded an end to the rule of traitors and national independence, peaceful reunification and democracy.
					
					 Lee's regime should roll back its hostile policy towards the DPRK and opt for implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration at an early date, it urged.
					
					 The article also demanded the regime stop joint military exercises with the U.S. aimed to invade the north, abrogate unequal treaties and halt at once such acts of treachery as submission to Japan crackdown on the movement for reunification and violation of the right to existence.

articles.title: Korean Writers, Artistes in Japan Mark 100th Birth of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Korean Writers, Artistes in Japan Mark 100th Birth of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Writers and artistes of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) met at the Korean Press House in Tokyo on April 21 to mark the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 Present at the meeting were Pae Ik Ju, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon and chairman of the National Rights Committee; Kim Jong Su, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Union of Korean Writers and Artistes in Japan; officials of the union in Kanto region, members of the Kumgangsan Opera Troupe and Tokyo Korean Song and Dance Ensemble and other Korean writers and artistes. 
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket before the portrait of smiling Generalissimo Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 A video "The leader and Koreans in Japan" was shown at the meeting. 
					
					 Then speeches were made by participants on the loving care shown by the great men of Mt. Paektu for the Korean writers and artistes in Japan. 
					
					 The speakers said with deep emotion that Kim Il Sung led them with profound care. 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il who was identical to Kim Il Sung helped the writers and artistes of Chongryon grow up to be Juche-oriented overseas Korean writers and artistes, they said. 
					
					 They pledged to uphold the dear respected Kim Jong Un with loyalty just as they trusted and followed Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il like Heaven. 
					
					 The participants heard a lyric "Hymn" praising Kim Il Sung and sang songs including "If I had wishes" reflecting their pledge to hold Kim Jong Un in high esteem. 
					
					 They expressed their will to provide a springboard for ushering in a new heyday of Chongryon without fail to remain loyal to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il forever.

articles.title: Koreans in US Call for Independent, Peaceful Reunification
articles.content:
Koreans in US Call for Independent, Peaceful Reunification
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Minjok Thongsin, an Internet newspaper of Koreans in the U.S., on April 18 carried an article calling for achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country through the great national unity. 
					 64 years have passed since the Joint Conference of Representatives of Political Parties and Public Organizations in North and South was convened in Pyongyang in April 1948 in order to prevent the nation's division, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The north is striving to achieve the peaceful reunification of the country through national solidarity, but the south Korean authorities are still standing aloof from the compatriots and turning their faces away from reconciliation and cooperation between the south and the north.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak "government" has consistently followed policies subservient to the U.S. and Japan and become all the more undisguised in its moves against the nation, peace and reunification.
					
					 Without the great national unity, it is impossible to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, the cherished desire of all the Koreans. 
					
					 They should preserve and adhere to the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration under the banner of the great national unity.
					
					 This is the way out for the Korean nation and the only road of carving out a bright future, the article concluded.

articles.title: Day of Sun Celebrated at DPRK Missions Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Sun Celebrated at DPRK Missions Abroad
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Celebrations of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung were held at DPRK missions abroad from April 5 to 15.
					 Receptions, friendship meetings, book and photo exhibitions and film shows took place at DPRK missions in Beijing, Dandong, Hong Kong of China, Nakhodka of Russia, Vietnam, Cambodia, Iran, Syria, Laos, Indonesia, India, Myanmar, Bangladesh, Nepal, Singapore, Malaysia, Egypt, Nigeria, Uzbekistan, Bulgaria, France and Mexico.
					
					 Displayed in their venues were works of the President and leader Kim Jong Il, photos on the revolutionary feats of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu and books and photos introducing the drive of the Korean people to build a thriving nation and their happy life.
					
					 The participants of the film shows watched Korean films "Pyongyang at Night", "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation", "The Country Shining with Arms of Mt. Paektu" and "Reply of Korea".
					
					 Present there on invitation were officials of governments, political parties, parliaments, organizations, institutions, Juche idea study organizations and organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people in relevant countries, personages of international and regional organizations and non-governmental organizations and foreign diplomatic envoys in relevant countries. Officials of the DPRK missions were present at the events.

Floral Baskets to DPRK Missions Overseas
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The governments, political parties, organizations, institutions and figures of various countries sent floral baskets to DPRK missions in the respective countries from April 6 to 15 in celebration of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Posted on Website of Russian Political Party
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Posted on Website of Russian Political Party
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- "6. Living Apart from the People Is Impossible" of "Chapter 15 Expansion of the Underground Front" from Vol. 5 of Part 1 Anti-Japanese Revolution of President Kim Il Sung's reminiscences "With the Century" was posted on the website of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation on April 14.

articles.title: Personages of Italy, Kuwait Pray for Kim Il Sung's Immortality
articles.content:
Personages of Italy, Kuwait Pray for Kim Il Sung's Immortality
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Personages of Italy and Kuwait issued statements on April 11 and 15 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Miriam Pelegrini Ferri, president of the Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy, said that Kim Il Sung is deeply revered by the world progressives for the undying feats he performed in the history of human thought and the history of anti-imperialist struggle.
					
					 Colorful significant events taking place in Italy and various other countries to remember him on the occasion of the Day of the Sun indicate that he is always alive in the hearts of the progressives, Miriam Pelegrini Ferri said.
					
					 Abdulreda Assiri, rector of the College of Social Sciences of Kuwait University, paid tribute to Kim Il Sung on the occasion of the centenary of his birth, praying for his immortality.
					
					  The DPRK is steadily advancing straight along the road indicated by Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un and is firmly maintaining its position in the international arena, too, the rector stressed.

articles.title: Warm Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Foreign Personages
articles.content:
Warm Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Foreign Personages
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received warm congratulations from foreign personages on his election as first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and first chairman of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Socialist Party of Bangladesh said in a statement on April 18 that Kim Jong Un's election as first secretary of the WPK and first chairman of the NDC of the DPRK is a historic event of great significance in strengthening and developing the WPK and carrying out Songun revolution. 
					
					 The general secretary expressed the conviction that the service personnel and people of the DPRK would achieve greater successes in the struggle for building a great prosperous powerful nation and achieving independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman and secretary general of the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism said in an article posted on Internet website in their joint name on April 14 that holding leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as general secretary of the WPK and chairman of the NDC of the DPRK forever and electing Kim Jong Un as first secretary of the WPK and first chairman of the NDC are a striking demonstration that the socialist cause of Juche is being steadfastly carried forward in the DPRK.
					
					 The former chairman of the Bolivia-DPRK Friendship Society said in an e-mail sent to the DPRK embassy on the same day the election of Kim Jong Un as first secretary of the WPK and first chairman of the NDC of the DPRK is an event that pleased all members of the society, wishing him greater success in his work.

articles.title: Nepali Literary Forum for Study of Songun Politics Formed
articles.content:
Nepali Literary Forum for Study of Songun Politics Formed
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The Nepali Literary Forum for the Study of Songun Politics was formed on the occasion of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Its inaugural ceremony took place in Katmandu on April 11.
					
					 Sonkori Baroti was elected chairman of the forum.
					
					 A congratulatory message to the dear respected Kim Jong Un was adopted at the ceremony.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Italy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Italy
 Pyongyang, April 24  (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instruction for National Reunification" was published in pamphlet by the Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 The work, published on August 4, 1997, deals with the immortal exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung in the cause of national reunification. It also formulates the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as the three charters for national reunification and indicates tasks and ways for carrying out the cause of national reunification on their basis.

articles.title: Racism, Misanthropy Rampant in US
articles.content:
Racism, Misanthropy Rampant in US
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Black people in the U.S. are bound to fall victim to killings by whites for the mere reason that they are black but they have no place to complain of this injustice. This is what happens in the U.S.
					  Teenage black schooler Martin was shot to death on way home by a chasing white policeman in Florida on Feb. 26.
					
					 The police authorities pretended to investigate the case by "walking away" the murderer to a police station but finally released him after concluding that the case was "just self-defence".
					
					 This inhuman action of the police authorities sparked off curse and denunciation among the black people.
					
					 Large protests held in several states including Florida, New York and California spread all over the U.S.
					
					 Another case of killing blacks broke out against the backdrop of mounting protest. 
					
					 On April 8 whites shot three blacks to death and wounded two blacks out of the passers-by while driving a car.
					
					 Much upset by the growing protest, a court in Florida held a press conference on April 11 and staged a farce of opening to public the truth about the murder of Martin.
					
					 Even at the press conference the court's side shielded the killer of Martin, claiming that he turned himself up to the law. This touched off the people's uproar.
					
					 It is the U.S. where killings do not cease under the patronage of law-enforcing elements including police and prosecution.

articles.title: American Education System Slammed
articles.content:
American Education System Slammed
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The educational system in the U.S. is an epitome of the society where money is everything. 
					 According to a recent survey, the debts the American students have to pay back for the money borrowed in order to cover their school expenses reached more than a trillion dollars.
					
					 Each graduate from secondary and high schools is saddled with debt amounting to 25,000 U.S. dollars on an average or 25 percent increase over that a decade ago.
					
					 There are some who have still failed to pay the money borrowed to cover school expenses late in the 1960s.
					
					 According to experts, lots of Americans are debt-ridden due to school expenses of their children as they could not manage to pay back the debts incurred by their own school expenses in the past. 
					
					 An increasing number of students are quitting schools halfway, unable to pay the daily rising tuition fees.
					
					 According to data available, 30,000 students are estimated to give up exam this year.
					
					 The rich-poor gap is reflected in the education field, deepening social contradictions.
					
					 Analysis of data in the 1960-2007 period made by experts of Michigan University said that the graduation rate between the rich and the poor reached over 50 percent since the 1980s.
					
					 All facts go to prove that the American society advocating "equality for all " and "welfare" is a corrupt society with no future as the poor students are denied even the elementary opportunity of learning.

articles.title: US Rejected in Continent
articles.content:
US Rejected in Continent
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The 6th summit of the Organization of American States (OAS) was held in Cartagena, Colombia on April 14 and 15.
					 The U.S. sought to turn the summit into a platform for isolating Cuba, sowing seeds of discord among Latin American countries and bolstering up its weakened influence in the region.
					
					 Cuba was excluded from the OAS in 1962 due to the U.S. pressure and plots. Even since a decision on lifting the exclusion was made in 2009 thanks to strong demand of regional countries, the U.S. has refused to give the status of full member to Cuba, asserting that democracy in the country is not in line with what it called charter.
					
					 When the U.S. barred Cuba from taking part in the summit, the regional countries stood firm against it in unity.
					
					 The presidents of Venezuela, Ecuador and Nicaragua protested the U.S. by boycotting the summit, declaring that a regional meeting without Cuba is impossible.
					
					 The summit held against this background further aggravated the conflict between Latin American countries and the U.S.
					
					 When the U.S. objected to mentioning in the final declaration the urgent issues of meeting the interests of the region including the issue of Cuba's participation in the next round of the summit, regional countries strongly opposed the U.S. stance in group.
					
					 The presidents of Colombia, Bolivia and other countries in their speeches branded the moves to isolate and blockade against Cuba as a product of the Cold War era, declaring such summit would never be held in the future.
					
					 The summit ended without adopting a final declaration because of differences between Latin American countries and the U.S.
					
					 The international community derides the U.S. driven into a tight corner for having pursued an anachronistic hegemonic policy.

articles.title: Venezuelan President Stresses Advantages of Socialism

articles.title: ALBA Nations Support Cuba

ALBA Nations Support Cuba
 Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- ALBA nations of Latin America made public a joint statement reaffirming their stand of supporting Cuba.
